Draw a line starting at [0.0, 0.0] with an endpoint at [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line starting at [0.75, 0.0] with an endpoint at [0.75, 0.1406]. 3. Draw a line starting at [0.75, 0.1406] with an endpoint at [0.0, 0.1406]. 4. Draw a line starting at [0.0, 0.1406] with an endpoint at [0.0, 0.0]. You should now have a closed loop using 4 line curves. The dimensions of the rectangular prism are 2 units in length (0.75 in width and 0.1406 in height), 1 unit in width (0.75), and 0.5 units in height (0.0703 in extrusion depth). Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Rectangular Hole Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the given Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0117, 0.0, 0.0]. Draw a line starting at [0.0088, 0.1406] with an endpoint at [0.0, 0.1406]. 4. Draw a line starting at [0.0, 0.1406] with an endpoint at [0.0, 0.0]. Sketch on the X-Z plane: 1. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketches Scale the 2D sketches using a scaling factor of 0.7266, as the `sketch_scale` value for both sketches is 0.7266.
